website_summaries.verdict: The Shine is one of the most stylish and futuristic-looking wireless fitness trackers out there, but you're trading in extra versatility for minimalist style.
pros: The Misfit Shine fitness tracker has a sharp design, is compatible with a variety of wearable accessories, and lasts four months on a single battery
it's also waterproof and can be used for swimming
cons: Minimal design doesn't display detailed data on the device
needs to be held close to phone screen to sync
currently has a closed app ecosystem

customer_reviews.title: This seemed to be the perfect thing, but it has failed me 4 times
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this seemingly incredible device 4 times over and every time the monitoring piece falls out of the band and is nowhere to be found. I have purchased this device 4 times and it is the most frustrating thing I have experienced in a long time. I want to track my activity and sleep without a big lug on my wrist. This seemed to be the perfect thing, but it has failed me 4 times. I highly DO NOT RECOMMEND!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device for my husband who is loosing weight and want to track is steps and sleep. It worked well for 39 day but then it stopped tracking. When we tried to reset the device it didn't work. When we attempt to contact support several different time we got no assistance from email or phone.
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda

customer_reviews.title: What happened?
customer_reviews.text: Appeared to be used, the battery area was scratched and appeared to be damaged, the battery was dead on arrival, and I couldn't sync have it as it appeared to be registered by someone other than me and support wouldn't help correct the issue. Too bad, my first shine lasted me nearly 10 years and now I'm never going to be a customer again.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. J

customer_reviews.title: Discreet, accurate, and simple
customer_reviews.text: Love the magnetic clip. A lot of my walking activities involve using my hands to carry things so I don't get the arm swing needed to count steps accurately with a wrist strap. I clip this to the top band of my sock or to my bra strap, get all my steps counted and it's completely unseen. The only thing I can't get accurately is the sleep. I work nights and when I sleep during the day it doesn't recognize that I am sleeping versus just not walking. At night it seems to reflect my sleep activity spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Christie D. McAllister

customer_reviews.title: Great looking device.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Misfit product. I made this purchase after my repeated disappointment with Fitbit (I've owned/replaced 3 Fitbit flex and a Fitbit One in the past 4 years due to battery failures). The very first "carrot" in making the switch to Misfit for me is a REPLACEABLE BATTERY. I've only had it for a few days now but I love the look of it. I'll come back and add more later as I gain a little more experience with the dashboard. I will note that the dashboard is quite different that Fitbit, but appears to have the features that I used/need. Be back after a few months of use...
customer_reviews.author: VDubber_wheee

customer_reviews.title: It counts some useless points just like Nike Fuelband counts their meaningless fuels
customer_reviews.text: I would give Misfit Shine 2 stars, but I am giving 3 stars just because my 10 years old daughter likes it very much. It is expensive and inaccurate pedometer. It counts some useless points just like Nike Fuelband counts their meaningless fuels. I've had different fitness trackers (nike fuelband for a year and a half, fitbit flex for a year and a half, fitbit zip for a couple of weeks, currently I am wearing fitbit charge hr). Misfit was a huge disappointment. I would return it, but my daughter wanted to keep it so I gave up. It is slim and stylish, but this is it. I paid $44, not worth it at all. Do not buy it.
customer_reviews.author: DZ

customer_reviews.title: Lasted six months
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a bad fitness tracker for what it does – keeps track of movement. It doesn't measure respiration, heart rate, blood pressure, etc., nor does it claim to. I found that it was pretty poor at measuring real work or strenuous climbs, pretty much just measuring your steps the same whether you were walking on level ground, uphill, digging ditches, making love, etc., if you went anywhere it measured it all the same; if you worked hard in one place you didn't get much credit. After six months and the second battery change it just quit altogether, wouldn't sync or power up. I will look into a more comprehensive device for the future.
customer_reviews.author: William G Dalzell

customer_reviews.title: Educate fury so you can make a purchase decision
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a secondary band because of all the reviews about people losing their Fitbit. The band I bought seems great. I love that this thing is water poof too! The reason I mentioned the band is because this doesn't keep consistent data. I don't know if that is because of the band we bought or if it is a design flaw with the product. My husband and I both have them. I love it more than he does (his data is inconsistent). I love the sleep monitoring. My watch isn't keeping accurate time anymore either. We bought it within the last two weeks. So you make the call. Happy shopping!
customer_reviews.author: postie

customer_reviews.title: Miss my Misfit
customer_reviews.text: I liked my misfit shine, but after wearing everyday for 8 months the shine popped out of the band and was never to be found again. I miss it because it was a good reminder to get up and move more and to keep track of my sleep patterns. I really liked that I could wear it in the pool at the Y and that it has batteries (which they sent as needed) instead of having to be charged in a separate unit. The misfit app improved and they frequently updated it. I'm debating if I should purchase another, and if so, which model. Also debating if I should bother at all. Decisions, decisions.
customer_reviews.author: Brokenbone

customer_reviews.title: LOVE MY MISFIT SHINE
customer_reviews.text: I don't need the latest technology. The only thing I have to take into account is the accelerometer is for an average person and I am a small female. So I get jipped a lot.
customer_reviews.author: JES

customer_reviews.title: Lost the puck in less than two weeks.
customer_reviews.text: This really should have been a five star review. It’s sleek, it’s waterproof, it tracks steps perfectly, and sleep automatically. Even the Bluetooth sync work flawlessly. However, less than two weeks in and I’ve already lost the puck. It slipped out one day while hiking, and here I am left with only a band. ***Updated 07/01/15*** A friend found the Misfit Shine on a follow-up hike. It survived being outdoors in the high desert for almost 2 weeks with no damage. I've since bought a third party band from Biaoge that will prevent the puck from coming loose. I really like this device, but having to buy additional gear to keep it secure knocks off one star.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Junyor

customer_reviews.title: This is a good fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: This is a good fitness tracker, it's accurate and reliable, and more flexible than some other devices that can only be worn on the wrist. It's good for all kinds of activities, including swimming, which I like. The automatic tracking of sleep is nice - no need to remember what time you fell asleep and woke up. Having a battery that you change instead of a rechargeable device is also much more convenient. The only thing I would change is the app - in Android, anyway, the sync is pretty unreliable. It can take 3-4 tries sometimes to sync. Sometimes it syncs the first go, others it takes a few tries. Not sure why this happens.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: This has been a great addition to my life and health
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great addition to my life and health. I enjoy wearing the clasp style under my clothes at work so I can keep up with my steps privately and then its great for workout and activities outside of work. Easy to setup and easy to sync. The sleep monitoring is very helpful for me as I am someone who struggles with sleep and this helps me see how restful I am really sleeping. Great price too! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: katherine88

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasts.
customer_reviews.text: This was my 3rd shine (all exactly alike). First I used for about 8 months. It worked great... Until I lost it scuba diving in a quarry. The second was fine for 4-6 weeks then started draining batteries. I'd replace the battery and within 18 hours it would be dead again. I bought this third one... Worked great for 3-4 weeks and stopped tracking my sleep (which was one of my favorite features). It is now in a drawer not being used.
customer_reviews.author: Xenyth

customer_reviews.title: Did not work out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: This item did not work. I purchased it has as a gift for a friend of mine. She waited to open it until closer to her birthday and it didn't work. She even tried to replace the battery, believing the problem might have stemmed from a dead battery. It did not. Now it is just seven days past the deadline to return it and I have a non-working present and no way to replace it or get my money back. She attempted to reach Misfit directly but guess what? No success just as I should have expected given the customer service ratings from other users. Waste of money. And worse yet, a failed present.
customer_reviews.author: Manny G.

customer_reviews.title: Good But Flawed
customer_reviews.text: I like many aspects of the Shine, but have a few issues. First of all, the sleep portion of the app is pretty hard to decipher. It's in a bar graph formation and doesn't convey the information in a clean, simple way. My biggest complaint is that the sport band pulls your hair. The snap inevitably catches multiple hairs when I reach back to put my hair in a ponytail. I think it may have been designed with only short hair in mind. Last, sometimes it's so hard to get it to respond-- I'm talking 10-15 taps. It's very picky about how you tap it. At times I've thought the battery was dead because it just wouldn't respond.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Falls out of arm band - A LOT - This last I lost the disc.... can't return it... would like replacement
customer_reviews.text: The disc won't stay in the band if you are doing activities. It's feel out multiple times and I have to put it back in the band. I would switch to the clip, but last night it fell out and I don't know where the disc is anymore. I will be appealing to my credit card for a refund. Cool device is it would just stay in the bracelet - expensive loss. Updated: Purchased another (my 3rd) lost it out of the band again. If you knock it the right way, it's gone. I would choose another tracker or wear it as a necklace or elsewhere so it doesn't pop out. I just bought another product all together. 7/20/2018.
customer_reviews.author: Khalisa

customer_reviews.title: Liked it a lot but...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased specifically for swimming. It kept fairly accurate stroke count but I want something that is totally accurate. The Shine never agreed with my count and I used it everyday while swimming and keeping count in my head. We never agreed at the end of my laps. Having said that about specific to swimming, it was great for everything else and it looked nice also.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Kiss

customer_reviews.title: So the tracker itself and the app seemed good. It linked nicely to my MyFitnessPal app
customer_reviews.text: So the tracker itself and the app seemed good. It linked nicely to my MyFitnessPal app. So why am I leaving such a poor review? IT FELL OUT OF THE BAND LESS THAN TWO DAYS AFTER I GOT IT. That can only be attributed to shoddy workmanship in regards to their band design. The disc of the tracker itself has a ridge on the sides that this flimsy little silicone band stretches around. The ridiculous part is I was not even exercising when it fell out, I was sitting on a city bus! I am so angry about this product. My money went right down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Speedo on Android. Zero customer support. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Does not sync with speedo app on Android. It's impossible to find this out on either misfit or speedo website. Finally heard from speedo, but never heard back from misfit. So it's maybe good if you have an iPhone (don't know), but I'd you're on Android it's just a slick looking analog watch with hamster wheel kinesthetics. It seems that Misfit is a marketing company that happens to have a technology to sell. Not a fitness technology company marketing to that audience. I had hoped to avoid a big clunky, expensive swim watch. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Btsfplk

customer_reviews.title: Good first go at it!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! I hope they will get better, like an activity breakdown by sport- and I think they will. I love not having to charge it. The only thing is you can swim your guts out, and you get like one extra dot. But, you bring in the groceries for 2 minutes and you get a dot. I hope they continue to refine. It also is too dim to see in daylight. Mine started out bright, then got dimmer. I might have to send back. I have to find dark bathrooms!
customer_reviews.author: C. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Great design,terrible qc, zero interest
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this device. Bought it for my GF and she loved it too. Unfortunately, I am THAT guy. I got not one but 5 SHINES that did not work. The first had a defect in the battery compartment. Second would not turn on at all. 3-5 were all variations on the same. Tech support was very responsive but the net of their response was that I had gotten a defective unit. Email only tech support and they can't compensate for defective manufacturing. Awesome design. Terrible quality control. Zero corporate interaction. I hope their product design team moves to a company that can execute on their vision.
customer_reviews.author: Peter H.

customer_reviews.title: Kept Falling Apart
customer_reviews.text: This item would probably be worth far more than one star if it worked. The one I received simply would not hold together once the battery was installed.It is possible that the elegant box included the wrong sized battery. More likely the design or manufacture of the case cut a corner somewhere. In the end I returned it to Amazon. This is the second inexpensive activity tracker I have returned because of what seem to be design flaws, and I have resolved to shop for them only in brick and mortar stores where I can make sure they work while I am still in the store.
customer_reviews.author: David K. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: The item looks pretty cool and I was super excited to get it. I read all about it and spent about ten minutes trying to get it turned on. I watched a YouTube video of how to make sure the battery is installed correctly. I enlisted help of two of my friends. I am pretty tech savy on my own. We finally figured out they sent my brand new device with a dead battery. Great customer service I gotta say. Sending it back due to that and the fact that it says you can swim with it but...the device will not last as long when exposed to salt water or chemically treated water.
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: Good tracker; terribly flimsy band.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the appearance and simplicity of this tracker. It tracks walking/running okay, but workouts aren't tracked that great. It labeled my 15 minutes session of HIIT as "light activity." However, my main gripe is with the silicone sports strap. As I continue wearing it, I can feel the bracelet get looser as a whole. The specific hole/notch I use also became looser. And it just fell off today, about a month after purchase. So, get this tracker if you're a big walker/runner, but make sure to get a different and more secured strap than the one that came with the package.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Decent device, poor band design
customer_reviews.text: i purchased this in July 2016. it doesn't keep real accurate tabs, but it was simple.it filled theneed of approximate measures. i like the sleep mode white sounds, that was very nice. unfortunately the design of the holder isn't great. last week the tracker popped off of my wrist and is completely gone! very disappointing. i would not purchase this again, because the device is gone! there was no way to secure it in the band. =(
customer_reviews.author: hapagirl

customer_reviews.title: Not for serious athletes
customer_reviews.text: If you attend the occasional aerobes class, want to measure your daily walks this is for you. As a fitness trainer it's completely inaccurate in the area of weights, yoga, suspension training...it does not measure any type of muscle building activity. It only measures activities that have quick arm movements...or for joggers you could attach it to your ankle. In theory, I could sit on the couch watching tv while shaking my wrist for an hour and it's going to tell me I met my fitness goal for the day. They need to rethink how they measure the "steps" and "calories burned".
customer_reviews.author: FT Fitness

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic ENTRY LEVEL fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof, wearable anywhere, affordable, "entry level", matches/syncd up with other aps if you want more features, this has been a great way to "test the waters of fitness trackers". Buying these as gifts for several folks who swore "if I had a tracker I would do better in training/diet/exercise" has allowed us to prove wether or not the expense much more advanced trackers would be a worth while investment. The only "missing" piece on this tracker is heartbeats, but it makes up for that with being waterproof for swimming.
customer_reviews.author: Talespinnerkitty

customer_reviews.title: Great Step Tracker
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these before and I lost it so I purchased another one. I'm very happy with it. The color and fit are as expected. The only issue is that it does not synch with MyFitnessPal, which is why this is getting a 4 star rating instead of 5.
customer_reviews.author: DeadAeris

customer_reviews.title: Shine is Bright
customer_reviews.text: I wear my Shine everyday - best over sleep/step monitor and watch. I choose this after wearing a Fitbit for a couple years (loved the Fitbit for steps). The Shine is the best combination device and had a professional appearance so can easily wear with business attire as well as workout and casual wear. No problem with the device falling out of the band - I did upgrade to a leather watch-style band as I did not like the look of the rubberized writ band. Interfaces with my health and nutrition apps too.
customer_reviews.author: loves shoes

customer_reviews.title: After compare, I believe this product is more worth to purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I received it today, and it looks perfect also with good feeling. Actually, I already have a similar one which is Jawbone brand. It also has fashion appearance and good feeling. The difference between these two item is that price and material. This product has more metal, but Jawbone brand has more plastic. I purchased $129.99 for Jawbone brand, and purchase $89.87 for this one. I compared both of them, the function almost same. I love both of them, cause both of them can encourage me to do exercise and keep me health. But for price, I think this product is more worth to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M-choice

customer_reviews.title: The function of the product was great and the app worked very well
customer_reviews.text: This would be five stars if it didn't keep popping out of the strap and ultimately end up being lost forever. It popped out three times in the few weeks that I owned this product and the last time it was permanent. The function of the product was great and the app worked very well. However, if you can't keep it then it is ultimately not worth anything. I guess I'm only out $80 but I feel like I wouldn't be out anything if the product was designed better. This is a very flawed design and you shouldn't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Klayton B.

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Needs
customer_reviews.text: Pros of the Misfit Shine - 1. No need for daily/weekly charging as batteries last up to 4 months 2. Able to track swimming 3. Aesthetically pleasing 4. Simple with minimal frills Cons - 1. Syncing to the iPhone is not very reliable and some times takes me a few attempts 2. Hard to read time Overall - I like it and has been wearing it daily for about a year now. Being a swimmer, this suits my needs. However, there are opportunities to improve the app and syncing.
customer_reviews.author: Peach

customer_reviews.title: Best activity tracker I've owned
customer_reviews.text: It works great. I've had a fitbit, Jawbone UP, UP24, Withings Pulse O2 previously. I still use the UP24 as my silent alarm, but I wear the Shine all the time. It tracks cycling (I bike to work), swim strokes (I go swimming 2-3 times a week) and does a great job of tracking my steps. I will say it does step tracking with a higher accuracy than any of my previous trackers, although I find it is most accurate when worn on my ankle (I clip it to my sock). I've had zero issues with it popping out, on both the sport band I use for swimming or the regular clip I use most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Ron G

customer_reviews.title: The app is on my phone but what good does that do
customer_reviews.text: I could not get it to sync with my phone. I tried last night, put it away and tried most of the day and still could not get it to sync. The app is on my phone but what good does that do. I contacted customer support and they tried to help with suggestions. When those didn't work I contacted them again and sent a photo of the serial number etc. and have yet to hear back today. I work and don't have time to mess with something that is this difficult to work with. I sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Kopecky

customer_reviews.title: Lousy
customer_reviews.text: This product is LOUSY! It took me 2 hours to get it to sync with my i-phone. There is NO customer service number to call for technical support. All you can do is email customer service and hope they get back to you, which I emailed them multiple times and still have not gotten a reply. The tracker does not do what it is supposed to do and doesn't even read my activity. The App is lousy as well. And I still couldn't get any activity to sync with the App. The App is difficult to understand. I am returning this lousy product and will end up getting a fit-bit. The only thing good about this product is it's looks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love the overall product
customer_reviews.text: I received this from my kids for Christmas. I love the overall product. The blue mechanical part fell out after a couple days. Luckily I was at home and heard it hit the floor. Yesterday I was out at many places and at some point it fell out again. Did not find it this time. So bummed. I do like the product and used it extensively but the band in my opinion turned out to be faulty I would have to say. Have not told my kids yet but i wish there was some way to track it other than just the light feature. Not even two week old....
customer_reviews.author: A. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: I like the accessories available but in general I clip it ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had my shine for 9 months. I use it daily. I like the accessories available but in general I clip it to my clothes. Recently I would find the device to be unresponsive, could get it back by pulling the battery out. Then t started to drain the new batteries very quickly. I reported the situation to the Misfit support. Their response time was fine, I heard back in about a day. They had me try a few things but shortly after I first contacted them they shipped me a replacement. I also got a pre-paid shipping label for the return. I like this device and I am very happy with the customer support. 5 stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Good for snorkeling
customer_reviews.text: I like the flexibility of where I can wear it because I do not do anything on my wrists. It easily attached to my swimsuit top for snorkeling. Downside is that when wearing on the waist, it can easily break loose from the magnet, thus making it easy to lose.
customer_reviews.author: L Koop

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, and they seem to have fixed the loose band problem.
customer_reviews.text: I put the battery in backwards at first...but after I stopped being dumb it worked great! Many people said that it isn't secure enough in the strap, and I strongly disagree. They provide an additional supporting back to make it more rigid and hold the shine in place now. With that, I have had absolutely no troubles with having it fall out, even running several miles, moving all of my stuff(just got a new house), and carrying a christmas tree home by myself. I've also showered with it on several times and still don't have any issues. One complaint - tap sensitivity. I wish it just had a button.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: defective band - very easy to lose the monitor
customer_reviews.text: My Misfit shine arrived on Jan 27 and I loved the simple design and the fact that it looks like a watch. Seemed to track my steps and sleep without problem. The app worked well on my Samsung Note 3. Everyone at work wanted to get one. Unfortunately, 4 weeks later, the thing fell off of my wrist somewhere in the airport as I was about to leave on a weeklong vacation . As much as I liked the Shine, I can't afford to shell out another $75 and lose it again. I am looking for another activity tracker.
customer_reviews.author: bluecookies

customer_reviews.title: Misfit Shine - silver
customer_reviews.text: A great product here! I bought it for two days now. This was meant to be a gift for my mother. however, after trying it for two days, I am totally in love with it! Just ordered a second one in black. The first one was silver. The led light does not show very well under sunlight, but the cool led lights effect that show the clock and the progress are very cool. This is totally worthy. If you are considering to buy an extra band, I recommend to buy different brands than Misfit. You could find a way better price with great quality! The extra leather band in the picture doesn't come with the shine. I bought it separately.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Chen

customer_reviews.title: Lost in less than 24 hours
customer_reviews.text: Did my research and decided this was exactly what I wanted. It was easy to set up, and worked great while I had it. I wish I would have considered all the reviews that said it comes out of the wristband too easily. I had it for less than 24 hours, and it was LOST. I went to check it, and it was no longer there. Searched unsuccessfully. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: T Pitcher

customer_reviews.title: Was good till it stopped working correctly
customer_reviews.text: I loved the size and weight of the Misfit but I am sad that it stopped working correctly. I had the Misfit for less than 1 month and the unit stopped lighting up unless I sync it with my phone or tablet. Right after a sync it would light up the correct amount of lights then that was it till I synced it again. The thing about a misfit is seeing the lights go around the face for motivation. I like that motivation and was very frustrated when it stopped working correctly. I am sending my misfit back and will try a fitbit charge this time.
customer_reviews.author: B. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Good idea gone bad
customer_reviews.text: Elegant product aesthetically, but ultimately a total fail: on the fifth or tenth or whichever time the Shine fell out of it's wristband cradle, I couldn't find it and had to write it off as a good idea gone bad. Put simply, the Shine stays in place most of the time, but if you bump into something or rub up against a surface, the Shine will dislodge and you probably won't notice immediately. I'm lucky frankly that mine lasted more than six months considering that it fell out of the band as least once a month.
customer_reviews.author: R R

customer_reviews.title: Finally a user friendly activity tracker!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my misfit since Dec (it's now July) I've been happy with my device and have found it to be pretty accurate when comparing to the step counter on my iPhone as well as my Nike run app. I'm happy with my product and do recommend it. On a side note my boyfriend dropped his little black disk from the center and found it later after it had gotten run over by a truck. It's scratched up but still works perfectly so it's a durable product too!!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Design flaws, mechanical flaws
customer_reviews.text: Update- I want to love this- but honestly, it has so many flaws. Try an upgraded version maybe? It is very attractive, for sure. I am still struggling with one I got about 10 months ago. It died after four months. They sent a replacement. It was missing the back strap piece to help secure it and read the device with tapping. I asked for a replacement for that. I am still waiting. They said they will send it. I sent another request today. The company means well. I am just too busy to keep after them. I want a device I can rely on.
customer_reviews.author: steelbird

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this. The look, the functions. I previously used the FitBit Flex but needed something waterproof, so I bought the Misfit. Also really like that this is a battery and don't have to charge through a device. It has a really nice look and is really comfortable. My fitbit bracelet ripped with all the taking it apart to charge etc. People have also stopped to ask about this, it is that nice looking. Only con I see is that they don't have an app that you can use on your computer, need to use a phone or iPad. I like to be able to use all 3.
customer_reviews.author: DKAP

customer_reviews.title: Loving it, and Misfit's customer service is top notch
customer_reviews.text: It has been interesting to see my tracking - I use it for walking and sleeping -- haven't tried to track other activities. I really enjoy wearing it - I get lots of questions. Customer service for Misfit is great, too. The magnetic clip broke the first time I tried to attach it. I contacted Misfit and they sent me a new clip right away. I just had to send them a photo of the broken one, and I received it in less than a week. I only wish I could tell time when my hands are full :-)
customer_reviews.author: Karla K

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for my girlfriend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my girlfriend as a gift because she had talked about getting a fitbit one and she absolutely loves it and wears it every day! She likes the way it looks, that it's smaller than most fitness trackers, that you never have to charge it, and it's versatility. It's great how it can be worn as a watch or a clip or even thrown in a pocket. The automatic sleep tracking is also great. I hope misfit comes out with a third model because it seems that the second version went away from the simple and useful aspects that the original shine has.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Davies

customer_reviews.title: Not for Android users!
customer_reviews.text: After buying this product (which I was very excited about) I realized that most of the advertised features only work on the iOS system. As I have android, I could not track anything but steps taken. It's a glorified, highly overpriced pedometer! Maybe they'll get the kinks worked out and maybe they'll realize that half of the consumer market is Android for future updates. Until then, I'll stick with my $1 pedometer that I bought 3 years ago and have still never changed the battery!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Misfit Shine
customer_reviews.text: I switched from Fitbit to the misfit shine. I like the Shine. It's comfortable, easy to use, and doesn't require charging. The accompanying app and features could be a little more, well, like Fitbit. I miss the silent alarm and the interaction with my friends though the Fitbit app. The misfit shine does have something fun called The Feed, where your accomplishments are posted for all to see (if you wish). But it can be difficult to find yourself. I'm hoping for some app updates. But honestly, am looking forward to the Fitbit charge hr.
customer_reviews.author: jksullycats

customer_reviews.title: the disc pops out very easily. Unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: I have had this device since April and it hasn't worked so well. When I can get it to light up, I find the data is often verifiably wrong. The app never syncs without multiple tries. Also, the disc pops out very easily. Unfortunately, I have found it every time. The disc is easily scratched as well. DONT BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Mallett

customer_reviews.title: Misfit tracker
customer_reviews.text: I must say, I am extremely disappointed in this fitness tracker. It is, basically, a pedometer...and not a very accurate one, at that. The sleep tracker is RARELY accurate...For example: I couldn't sleep at all one night. I spent the entire night reading. I even took a shower at about 4AM. This device tracked me sleeping for 9.5 hours...with the deepest sleep noted when I was IN THE SHOWER! Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Ann Woods

customer_reviews.title: Loved it.... until it went AWOL
customer_reviews.text: I loved my shine.... I loved the elegance, the fact that it was an analog style watch, the very sleek design that allowed for interchangability with other accessories. Unfortunately, that very elegance and interchangibility proved to be the Shine's fatal flaw; for whatever reason, the sport watch band's elasticity began to break down and by the third month, it went AWOL on me in the grocery store while child wrangling. It's a beautiful and unique item, I loved that it tracked my sleep, and I mourn it's loss. Unfortunately, the cost prevents me from easily replacing it, as I have other monetary obligations.
customer_reviews.author: C. Spar

customer_reviews.title: Don't have to take it off, ever.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I have not taken it off or about a month, except to switch risks to avoid tan lines at the beach. It's been through workouts, cleaning dishes, working on cars, working on the house, swimming in fresh water, swimming in the ocean and all sorts of other things. Wish it had a heart rate monitor too, but that's asking quite a bit for such a small device. It can handle deeper depths of water than the FitBit and has a built in clock, though that can be a little difficult to read in bright light. Overall, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: UncleJesseRP

customer_reviews.title: Misfit Shine is all that and more
customer_reviews.text: I love my Shine. It is stylish and functional and I know I am more aware of my need for exercise and to hit my goals than ever - which is good. I especially like that my Shine is also a watch - allowing me to wear it as "jewelry" as well as an activity monitor. I have recommended the Shine to several others, too, who were not disappointed. In sum, if you are looking for something to wear to the office as well as to the gym and that provides the incentive you need to get out there an move, the Shine is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kirkbride

customer_reviews.title: It works great.  Very comfortable.  Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: It works great. Very comfortable. Easy to use. The auto-sleep tracking works very accurately. The magnetic clasp works well during a workout when I'm wearing a heart rate monitor. The watch feature is easy to use, and surprisingly works excellently when I wake up at night and want to check the time. The data view is a bit limited. I've also found that I can sync on my iPad or Android phone, but if I do both it gets confused and loses data. Overall, it works well tracking my base activity level. And it works in conjunction with my workout tracking devices.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere for a fitness tracker...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this thing but for 2 months and the battery died within the first month (and I only synced if once a day) and now it won't turn on at all and for some reason I cannot return it or get in contact with Misfit about it. It wasn't bad when it actually worked but now I am stuck with a broken product and no way to get this resolved.
customer_reviews.author: TFow323

customer_reviews.title: It's the right direction for what that is worth, just poor software and customer support.
customer_reviews.text: This does technically work with a Windows Phone, but it is a pain to sync, it won't tell you there is a firmware update and a bunch of features including the clock won't work without the update, the updates are hidden in a diagnostic screen that has no documentation, actually no documentation for using it with Windows Phone at all, support was super lazy in getting back to me, and the monitoring was very inconsistent. Battery life was good, style is good, never had an issue with the band.
customer_reviews.author: S. Dahlgren

customer_reviews.title: Easily lost
customer_reviews.text: The shine is a great product for tracking activity. I loved the size of the tracker and the fact that is is battery operated so you don't have to worry about charging. However, this is the second Shine I have bought that came loose from the sports band and was lost. The first one purchased was defective and replace. Then not a month later came out of the band and was lost. The second one I purchased I had for a little over 2 months and it came loose while shopping and it lost. If you don't want to waste your money having to replace this product every 1-3 months then I suggest you buy another activity tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun while it lasted...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this- it was less clunky looking than the other trackers on the market and fit my activities pretty well. unfortunately it looks better than it works, i had a really hard time getting it to sync with the App- it would take 3-4 tries every time i synced it. After a week of use I was kind of fed up with the device and was going to return it but the Shine disk fell out of the strap sometime this weekend while moving boxes- the band is kind of stretchy around the disk and it does not take much to dislodge the unit...if i find it again i will send it back!
customer_reviews.author: Bumble52

customer_reviews.title: Save for a different device
customer_reviews.text: Save your money for a fitbit. The misfit does not track my time on a treadmill (even when I put it in my shoes) does not track yoga time, and is not accurate when tracking my sleep. I am very disappointed. The Misfit also arrived with a dead battery, and if I had not purchased replacement batteries when i bought it originally, I would have been out of luck until they arrived. I really regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Stephan

customer_reviews.title: Wrong color
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy that I got my misfit but I did not get it in the color that I ordered so I'm not happy about that yet I'm anxious to go ahead and start using it so I'm going to make do with the boring gray color, I actually ordered the seafoam color, but at the same time I will use this one as a test project because I do a lot of swimming and will see if it even makes the cut. If it fails me then the next time I may just buy one in the department store
customer_reviews.author: susie

customer_reviews.title: Features only work with IOS! (NOT Android!)
customer_reviews.text: I was VERY excited for this product to track running and swimming. All of the cool features, like counting laps and tracking fitness actives separately, are NOT available with the Android app. This is a major disappointment. The only thing the app does is track "fitness activity" by way of points. You can't see how far your swam, run, etc. Don't buy this unless you have iOS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as Misfit thinks it is.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work well with Android phones - the information it provides does not allow for interaction - if I want to see how long a period of sleep was, I can't. I can just see blocks of time. It seemed to be pretty accurate and I liked that it was water resistant, but I returned mine. Also, the surface of the watch scratches super easily - I don't do a lot of rough activities, but after a month, there were at least a dozen noticeable scratches on the surface of the watch. Syncing was a HUGE pain - it had to be done manually, and did not easily sync with my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Sar Swan

customer_reviews.title: Loved the shine for about 4 months
customer_reviews.text: A great product with a customer service culture that 100% backs their products. Having a waterproof fitness tracker that does not require weekly charging was the main reason for selecting Misfit and I am glad I did. It is lightweight and sleek that I don't even notice I am wearing it compared to other brands I have tried. Simple and efficient, I never take it off. Fitbit had a few design flaws and I was having to charge it daily towards the end of its few month lifespan, Shine has been great even when I had my unit replaced for a battery drain.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: You can also see in the pictures that it looks like the Shine was not in fact new
customer_reviews.text: When I try to sync the Shine to the Misfit app it struggles to find it and fails syncing frequently. I finally got it to sync by removing the battery and then replacing it, but that shouldn't be required. I believe the Shine is defective. You can also see in the pictures that it looks like the Shine was not in fact new, as said on the product page, because the box was re-taped and the original seal was already cut open. Why would you send an opened used product when the listing says new?
customer_reviews.author: L. Frye

customer_reviews.title: Stops working
customer_reviews.text: I loved my misfit. It worked well for several months, but after about four months the battery died and upon replacing it, the tracker didn't work well anymore. It would randomly delete my progress from a workout or from sleeping, even though it recognized my battery was full. When it was working well I bought my mom one too and it stopped working after a few months as well. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nonsensicalmuse

customer_reviews.title: Great product, Great company
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! It Tracks your activity showing how many steps you have taken and calories used. I like the fact that after my aerobics class I can see just how hard I worked out. The Shine is also the only tracker on the market right now that you can swim with. The sleep tracker is very interesting as it to shows how long you are in deep sleep. I bought the Shine to have something to show the Dr. just how active I am, at night as well it seems. The customer service is fantastic, they respond very quickly when you have any questions. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: wine lady

customer_reviews.title: The misfit shine is far the more durable than fitbit one.
customer_reviews.text: I have had both the fitbit one and the misfit shine. The misfit shine is far the more durable of pedometers. a single drop water and the fitbit would start getting wonky, the misfit works fine with no issues. I usually clip it inside my pocket to the interior fabric, I haven't had any issues with it falling out. If you don't clip it to fabric your keys or metal will pull the shine right out of your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Rarity

customer_reviews.title: Good idea- horrible customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Even though the idea for the Misfit itself is a good one, the bands and clips that hold them is horrible. After about a week, the band gets weak and won't hold the misfit. Any little bump and it pops out. If you are not paying attention, it will be gone and then you spend a lot of time trying to find it. The Misfit customer service is even worse. They do not stand behind their products at all. They offer a 60 day satisfaction guarantee, but trying to get them to honor it is nearly impossible.
customer_reviews.author: L Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I get a lot of questions and then compliments on my Misfit. It works so well for my needs. The fact that it is waterproof and I can wear it while swimming or bathing is so nice. With the Bioage Wrist Strap it looks sleek and like a nice watch. It does a great job tracking my sleep and I love the positive responses I get when I hit my goal. The only thing I want is it to track my heart rate. That would be awesome. For the price, this is s affordable product that looks stylish and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel V

customer_reviews.title: The actual fitness tracker is fantastic. However...
customer_reviews.text: The actual fitness tracker is fantastic. However, the methods of keeping it on your person are lackluster. I have lost this tracker several times, both on the wristband and with the magnetic clip. Thankfully, I was able to re-trace my steps and find it again. Update 10/5/15: It finally happened. The tracker popped out of the sports band while swimming off of the coast of Aruba. Thankfully, Misfit Support treated me very well. They got me a replacement Shine and also provided one of their leather bands to keep it better secured to my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Steven A. Dear

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this watch
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this watch. The design and weight is nice but the tracking is terribly inaccurate. Activity logging is all over the place. Doesn’t pick up full exercise. Logs exercises differently than what it is. Sleep tracking is the worst. Picks up half a nights sleep or won’t acknowledge it at all. Day naps are never recognized. This thing has been a headache every day for the past 2 weeks. Will be returning and trying out a Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: William M Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Beware of used stuff.
customer_reviews.text: If you want a basic activity tracker, I've been very happy with my first Shine. I lost it so my wife bought me this one. I will say however, I don't see anything on this purchase saying this was a used Shine. When I opened the shipment the box had a little wear on it and the back plate of the Shine itself, where you use a small screwdriver to open the back plate to insert the battery; had a good amount of scratching on it. Buyers be-aware.
customer_reviews.author: iain

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when I read the reviews for he Misfit! I was going to buy a Tidbit but after he reviews stated that the Misfit is much better I took a leap of faith and an so glad I jumped! This product is wonderful! I have major sleep issues and it is the main reason I bought it but it has also helped me to become motivated to exercise! I wear it on the watchband and it has fallen off a few times by luckily I have found it both times as soon as it did. They could tweak that a bit. Buy it you will not regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Dmurowany

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad so he could wear it on his neighborhood walks. It’s pretty accurate compared to my Misfit 2 which I don’t go anywhere without. I hope it helps him continue his healthy trend! If not, then it wasn’t too much of a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Stetts

customer_reviews.title: Superb customer service!!
customer_reviews.text: I received my MisFit Shine and was very impressed with the low profile design. I wear it on my wrist and it is very lightweight. My only concern is the battery life. I purchased the item less than a month ago and I'm on my 4th battery. I've been trying to contact the manufacturer to determine if this is normal or a malfunction in my unit. I haven't heard back yet. Otherwise I like the functionality of the device and the look. The manufacturer was very responsive to the battery issue. I apparently received a defective product. They replaced it promptly.
customer_reviews.author: TERESA HALL

customer_reviews.title: I like the shine in terms of having a device that ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the shine in terms of having one device that tells time, tracks steps and sleep and looks good. However, it seemed like the device had to be constantly synced because it would stop telling time and maybe that had to do with having an android phone and not an iphone. Also, I lost my shine yesterday when it slipped out of the watch band. However, Misfit responded promptly and are sending me another one at no charge. I will say their customer service has been very good about responding to my questions and now sending me another device. I'd owned the other one for a month.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn J. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Jewelry AND Fitness Tracker
customer_reviews.text: I love my Misfit. I wear it every day and usually sleep with it on. I get compliments on it because it looks more like jewelry than a fitness tracker, which was my purpose for choosing it! I knew i would be more likely to wear it if it was cute rather than chunky and ugly, especially being in a corporate office all day. It works great, and I've only had to replace the battery once, which was in line with companies claims of battery life.
customer_reviews.author: K. Z.

customer_reviews.title: Non-functioning product, non-functioning customer support
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to use my new Misfit but when I arrived it wouldn't even turn on. Misfit technical support took 3 days to determine it was not functional, but they apparently don't have any more of these devices to send me a new one. So they offered me a gift card to some crappy watch site that doesn't even sell the device I purchased. I never leave reviews, but this was such an appallingly bad experience with both the product and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda K.

customer_reviews.title: Workmanship not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my daughter. She had a misfit before but lost it. She loves this style of this fitness tracker but it has not been functioning correctly for several months now. I am disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth A Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Six weeks after purchase and device runs as advertised. ...
customer_reviews.text: Six weeks after purchase and device runs as advertised. Then software update installed. Now it keeps time and that is all (11/12/15) Sometime after I wrote this review the device started consuming batteries like they were Jelly Bellys. Query to company resulted in getting a new/replacement device which leads in my upgraded opinion - device works as advertised, and battery budget now under control.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Dead after four months
customer_reviews.text: After four months, this product is dead. I had read other reviewers saying the same thing. However, I thought that maybe they had mistreated their Shine somehow and broken it. Mine went dead with no scratches, no abuse and no warning. I thought it was the battery, so I changed the battery a couple of times. It has not came back to life. Four months of use and it is just DEAD! If someone has a fitness band that seems tried and true, please let me know. I am so disappointed with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya G

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware if purchasing a Misft Shine product. Ordered 2 and neither would work as touted.  Despite buying fresh batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. Ordered one and it did match the photo as displayed. There were no pinpoint holes in the uppercase to allow the light to be visible or sync device with iPhone or iPad 3 using the Misfit Shine App downloaded from the Apple App Store. When I followed the instructions on reporting the issue and asking for assistance all I received was a plethora of non response e-mails and no follow-up by telephone. So my advice is purchase at your risk. I would never purchase from this Amazon seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Buck

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend buying this tracker.
customer_reviews.text: Very well done, has one small issue that I've reported... But the device is lightweight, works well, and is comfortable and flexible in where you locate it. I would recommend buying this if you want a reasonably priced activity tracker. Positives: Comfortable, lightweight, flexible in where you place it. Negatives: Only two small glitches. It randomly does not track sleep data, and the interface to other applications like "My Fitness Pal" is not complete. I would recommend buying this if you want a reasonably priced activity tracker
customer_reviews.author: michael steven

customer_reviews.title: Not Ready For Prime Time  ... Here.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted it to work - and from reviews it does for some people. Not here - I had one and my wife had one. Maybe time will improve a good looking and good idea product. We can wait.
customer_reviews.author: Johnhsv

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, but not impressive.

I liked the look of it because it was so streamlines and smooth looking, but when you add the belt clip (you can very vaguely see the loop around the band in the photo) the magnet bulks it up and it's just not the same. I returned my because of this, and the fact that I wanted something to sync up to the Healthy Solutions program that my company uses, and Misfit doesn't sync to it, so I'm back to Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: plannergirl

customer_reviews.title: Misfit Shine is a great option if you care about how your fitness tracker ...
customer_reviews.text: Misfit Shine is a great option if you care about how your fitness tracker looks, and not just how it performs. Performance-wise, the Basis watch wins hands down. But the Shine gives you the core functionality (sleep tracking, steps) in a package that looks good on you. Reading time on this is a pain (4-5 step process), so if you are looking for a watch-cum-tracker, this is not the product for you. Buy it if you want to look good wearing it, and also get some basic tracking done
customer_reviews.author: rdz

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Fitnesss Tracking Device!
customer_reviews.text: I usually am the first to buy and try out new technology items; my wait and observe mode served well. After doing research on various fitness tracking monitors, I selected the Misfit Shine and am very pleased. You do have a mind shift once you see how your sleep patterns differ day to day. Just bought one for my husband's brithday and my next buy will be the Beddit Sleep Monitor to get a better reading on my sleep quality. Product is well made, light weight and fits my small 6" wrist.
customer_reviews.author: hi.sphiff

customer_reviews.title: One of the worst purchases I've made
customer_reviews.text: One of the worst purchases I've made. It worked great for about 6 weeks and I convinced my mom that she needed one too. Shortly thereafter, both stopped working. The watch function works rarely, if ever. I suppose the fitness/ sleep tracker works alright but sometimes it just stops synching. I think it might have something to do with its proximity to the phone, so if you don't have your phone with you all the time... Don't expect much. It's really pretty when it lights up, so there's that.
customer_reviews.author: a history lover

customer_reviews.title: Love my misfit
customer_reviews.text: Love my misfit. This is my third one because I lost my previous three (my own fault). It beats the fitbit (which my wife has) hands-down for my purposes. It is perfectly water-proof (so you can wash it right along with yourself in the shower and wear it swimming). customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Bell

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife, and we've had nothing but problems with it. The sports band that it comes with is atrocious. We tried a new battery, even though the battery itself was only 1 month old, but to no avail. I would recommend buying different product, that's what we're doing.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Miller

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, loved my shine, which I received for Christmas. Hate the fact that I lost it exactly a month after I received it (after wearing it nonstop for a month) when it apparently popped out of the strap that it came with. Serious design flaw there, misfit. I love the shine, it syncs well and it really motivated me, and I got lots of compliments. But, it is an expensive toy to lose within a month because the strap designed to hold it doesn't hold it securely.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Y

customer_reviews.title: Worked for about a month and then died!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was one of the few fitness trackers that allowed me to use it for swimming. Although I enjoyed it for about a month, it started chewing through my batteries right after the warranty period Amazon offers. I was unable to return or exchange!! It would die after about 3 days and I would put a new battery in and, same thing. Would die after about 3 days. I will not buy again. Totally defective piece of garbage...
customer_reviews.author: pka

customer_reviews.title: Color is not as bright product works well though
customer_reviews.text: I love my misfit as far as the actual product goes however the picture is a bit deceiving in regards to the color. I was expecting it to be a bringer minty green but instead it is a dull silver green. I still like it it's just not what I was expecting but the product itself works great! The new action clip that comes with it was a much needed add on to help it stay in place! I lost my other one from it popping out but it hasn't this time with the new clip.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: I love the product
customer_reviews.text: I love the product, when it works it is marvelous. But then it stops working. I've had intermittent issues though and when the support person finally acknowledged it was defective I replied and didn't get a response for several days. When I got the response they asked me to wait for a return label, ship it back, and then a replacement would be shipped. This is really unsatisfactory. Ship the replacement and I'll ship the defective unit! Even UP did that. I'm really becoming disillusioned by Misfit. :( Now I am again waiting for a response. . .waiting ... waiting.
customer_reviews.author: Dharma

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. I wanted something that would blend in, was easily worn in a work setting (I'm always in a dress - aka no pockets and I don't care for jewelry), and that didn't break the bank. My misfit shine did great at meeting my expectations. It does have syncing issues and 9 out of 10 times will fail when first syncing... But I t will eventually "connect" so as long as you have a little patience, it works fine. For the beginner/intermediate exercise enthusiast, I think this is a great fit. I've only worn it with the small magnet clip accessory and have never had issues with losing it, which was a concern of other reviewers.
customer_reviews.author: Becca Kohler

customer_reviews.title: I wanted something that wasn't bulky and looked nice. When I started looking into different models
customer_reviews.text: I knew I wanted a fitness tracker for Christmas 2014, and I ended up choosing a Misfit Shine. I wanted something that wasn't bulky and looked nice. When I started looking into different models, I initially liked the Misfit Shine because of all of the different colors you could choose from. When I realized you didn't have to charge the battery and it was waterproof, I knew wanted a Misfit Shine. I choose Seaglass because it was a more neutral color. The Misfit app is very user-friendly and easy to use. I've worn my Shine every day since December, and I haven't had any problems!
customer_reviews.author: Justine Steele

product_meta.title: Misfit Shine - Activity and Sleep Monitor
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Package Type:Standard PackagingThe Misfit Shine is an elegant activity and sleep tracker that inspires you to live a more active life. Shine emits a halo of lights that shows your progress towards your daily activity goal while looking like a fashionable accessory. By seeing how active you are during the day, Shine helps motivate you to reach your goal every day. Shine tracks walking, running, cycling, swimming (up to 50 meters deep)
Frequently Asked Questions
What mobile devices are supported?
Misfit Shine is compatible with iPhone 4S/5/5C/5S/6/6 Plus, iPod Touch 5th Gen and above, iPad 3/4/Air/Mini (all running iOS 6.13 and above), Samsung Galaxy S4/Note 3, Google Nexus 4/5 (Or other BLE ready Android devices running software 4.3 and above) and BLE ready Windows Phone running software 8.1 and above.

What do you mean by no charging ever?
The Misfit Shine is powered by a replaceable battery, found in quartz watches. Misfit recommends replacing it with a Panasonic CR2032 3V Lithium Coin Battery; other coin batteries may not be compatible. For battery installation, refer to the User Manual and view the battery installation video.

How do I sync my Misfit Shine?
To sync the Misfit Shine, download and open our Misfit app in the App Store on iOS, Google Play on Android and turn on Bluetooth. If the sync fails, you can reset the Shine by removing and reinserting the battery or turn off and back on the Bluetooth under your device settings or simply restarting your mobile device.

Why should I buy my Misfit Shine from Amazon?
Misfit products are sold through an exclusive network of authorized dealers selected by Misfit, including sold by Amazon.com. Misfit’s warranty policy covers only products purchased through authorized dealers. To ensure that your Misfit product is authentic and protected by our warranty, please purchase from an authorized dealer, such as Amazon.com. Misfit products sold through third-party marketplace sellers may not be authentic and are not covered by Misfit’s warranty policy.
feature_bullets: White LED progress and time display
Wirelessly syncs with paired smartphone to upload data
